授業目的: This course will focus on ways to compare and analyze cultures and societies, consideration will be given to theoretical/methodological issues and concrete phenomena. Since you are studying in Japan (and I assume you are interested in some of its aspects) we will direct comparisons between your home culture(s) and their institutions or social phenomena and those found here. First, we will explore some of the ways cultures/societies have been compared, and then look at practices and phenomena that are shared or not shared with your countries.
到達目標: The courses final objective is for you to work in groups to research and do some field study on an aspect that you decide to look into and give a presentation of it at the end of the course (more details will be explained in class). Classes will have three elements, namely, lectures where I will talk about particular topics, class discussions/individual contributions about topics and practice exercises assigned, and group work for presentations.
授業方法: In accordance to KGU guidelines (at the time of this submission) classes will be conducted by in-classroom Face to face format.  Classes will consist of lectures and discussion on assigned readings of pertinent articles and texts (in translation). If class size permits students will be asked to make presentations. Also, field trips to places related to course content may be planned. Language of instruction, English.

第1回: Course introduction. Explanation of requirements and grading. Purpose of presentations. Getting to know each other. What is culture and how can it be compared (working model of societies and cultures)? “Expectations and actual impressions” assignment. Individual interests?
第2回: Discussion of “Expectations” assignment. Considerations for comparisons; Political and Religious spheres. Where are the centers of “power”?
第3回: Considerations: Knowledge and Aesthetic sensibilities. Their purposes and functions?
第4回: Considerations: Economy and technology (mainstream order) vs. Peripheral and anti-social, or alternative, trends, and movements.
第5回: Considerations: Past, present and future. Ethnic/communal/national (historical consciousness or world views) and relationship with ideologies and shared visions.
第6回: The gaze from the Other, the gaze towards the Other. How Japan has been seen and how the Japanese see themselves and the world. The problem of nihonjin-ron. (Three Point Comparison method explained and assignment)
第7回: Short contributions of a Three Point Comparison and discussion.
第8回: Group presentation preparations. (Groups will be chosen at an earlier date and some work will be in progress)
第9回: Lectures or explanations of specific topics concerning Japan. Group work with instructor’s feedback.
第10回: Lectures or explanations of specific topics concerning Japan. Group work with instructor’s feedback.
第11回: Group Presentations. This will depend on number of groups.
第12回: Group Presentations. This will depend on number of groups.
第13回: Group Presentations. This will depend on number of groups.
第14回: Final discussions about presentations and general conclusions of what was learned.
トピック.授業外学習2: A few readings will be assigned, and there will be a number of written submissions done outside of class hours during the course. These generally are for lecture background and in-class discussion purposes. Also, students will be required to research, prepare and give group presentations. Although limited class time will be devoted to preparations, each group is responsible to find extra time out of class to prepare as well.
